definition: to conceal from/to keep (sb) in the dark
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

sentences.english: Mehra (Saeed Jaffrey). Hazriprasad decides to fool Mr. Mehra by pretending he too is a millionaire businessman. Mr.
sentences.chinese: 南宮想瞞騙傻沙，假裝他自己也是富有的商人。

sentences.english: As a nation, we have little capacity for deception.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個國家，我們不善於瞞騙。

sentences.english: In a deal suspected deception and losses.
sentences.chinese: 在一次收購交易中懷疑被瞞騙而損失慘重。

sentences.english: Our politicians want to trick the world into thinking things are great here.
sentences.chinese: 政客想瞞騙整個世界，讓大家覺得巴西很好很棒。

definition: to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
(idiom) to talk in a roundabout way to cover up the truth/evasive
